title: 11.3 Treatment - kgt34
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor vmbo kgt, leerjaar 3 en 4. Dit is thema 11 'Health and care'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Treatment. In deze les staat kiespijn en keelpijn centraal, waarbij er gesproken wordt over de tandarts en zijn patiënt, mondhygiëne, verkoudheid (en keelpijn) en de huisarts. De onregelmatige werkwoorden in deze les zijn: to hold, to keep en to know. In de grammaticaopdracht worden de demonstrative pronouns behandeld.

items.content:
Het onderwerp van dit blok is kiespijn en keelpijn.

  • Maak groepjes van drie of vier leerlingen.

Bespreek de volgende vragen in jouw groepje:

  • Wat heb jij vaker, kiespijn of keelpijn?
  • Wat is erger, kiespijn of keelpijn? Waarom?
  • Vertel iets wat je bij de tandarts of huisarts is overkomen.
  • Wat moet je doen tegen keelpijn?

Bekijk hieronder de stappen die je gaat zetten.

Succes.

Step

Friendly dental care

You are going to listen to a conversation between a dentist and his patient.

  • Listen to the conversation and do assignment 1.
  • Read the questions.
  • Listen again and do assignment 2 and 3.

Assignment 1

Listen to the conversation and answer the question on your own, then discuss the answer in your group.

  • What is funny about this conversation?


Questions

  1. What is the man's initial reason for visiting the dentist?
  2. What problem does the dentist discover when he takes a look in the patient's mouth?
  3. When does the man feel discomfort?
  4. What is one method of treatment the dentist does NOT mention?
  5. What does the dentist use to minimize the patient's pain during the procedure?

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer to the question.

What is the man's initial reason for visiting the dentist?

content.body: He wanted to have a filling replaced.
He needed to have a tooth pulled.
He came in for a dental check up.

prompt.body: What problem does the dentist discover when he takes a look in the patient's mouth?

content.body: The man has a chipped front tooth.
The man has a decayed back tooth.

prompt.body: When does the man feel discomfort?

content.body: when he chews on hard foods.

prompt.body: What is one method of treatment the dentist does NOT mention?
What does the dentist use to minimize the patient's pain during the procedure?

content.body: no medication is needed in this case

Fill in the gaps.

Patient: Hi. Dr. Hyde?

Dentist: So, what's seems to be the problem today?

Patient: Well, I just came in for a and a dental cleaning.

Dentist: Hum. Open up. Let's take a look ...

Patient: Okay. Uh ...

Dentist: Hummmm. [Humm? Uh?] Wow! I've never seen one like THIS before. Let me try this.

Patient: Uhhh ... Ouhhhh [Man screaming in pain ...]

Dentist: Well, besides a lot of plaque buildup, there is a in one of your wisdom teeth. [I feel that.] Hasn't this given you any trouble?

Patient: Well, the tooth has been bothering me, and it sometimes when I drink something cold. Does it look that bad?

Dentist: Well, we're going to remove the decay, and then we'll either put a in, or if the decay is extensive, we can't repair it, we might have to put a crown on your tooth. Or as a last resort, we may have to .

Patient: Uh, well, that sounds painful!

Dentist: Don't worry. I've done this . . . once before. [Huh?] Nah, just relax.

Patient: Wait! Aren't you suppose to give me something to dull ?

Dentist: Uh, chicken. Oh yeah. I almost forgot. We can either use a local anesthetic or nitrous oxide . . . laughing gas. . . to minimize you might feel. Or you can just grin and bear it.

Patient: Nah, Nah, nah! Put me under! [I thought so.] I can't stand pain, and I'd rather not be aware of what's . And, if I need a filling, can I get one that looks like my other teeth?

Dentist: If we can save the tooth with a filling, I recommend a high-strength silver alloy filling instead of a porcelain one. It'll probably .

Patient: Okay, well whatever. Let's get it over with.

Dentist: Okay, pleasant dreams. .

items.content:
What causes a sore throat?

You are going to read a text about a common cold and what to do about it.

  • Read the text and do assignment 1.
  • Read the text again and do assignment 2.

Assignment 1

  • On your own, read the text and put the headings below in the right place (1-4).
  • In your group, discuss your answers.

headings:

  • If my doctor doesn't give me antibiotics, what can I do to feel better?
  • Why not just give everyone antibiotics?
  • Should I be concerned about any other symptoms that occur after I visit my doctor?
  • How does the doctor decide if I need antibiotics?

What causes a sore throat?

Many things can cause a sore throat. These causes include infections with viruses or bacteria, or sinus drainage and allergies, among others. You should see your doctor right away if you have a sore throat with a high fever, if you have problems breathing or swallowing, or if you feel very faint. If you have a sore throat and a fever, but you just feel mildly ill, you should visit your doctor within the next day or two. If you have a cold with sinus drainage, you may use over-the-counter medicines, like Sudafed or Actifed. Visit your doctor if this cold lasts for more than two weeks, or if it gets worse.

1 ...
The decision to prescribe antibiotics might be based only on your history and physical exam. Antibiotics usually are prescribed only for patients who might have "strep throat," an infection caused by a bacteria called Streptococcus. A patient with strep throat might have a sore throat with fever that starts suddenly, without a cough or cold symptoms. Strep throat is very common in children from 5 to 12 years of age. The exam might show a red throat, with pus on the tonsils and swollen neck glands. If you have these signs, the doctor may do other tests to see if you need an antibiotic.

2 ...
Antibiotics have a small risk of causing an allergic reaction every time they are given. Some of these reactions are serious. Antibiotics can also cause other side effects, such as an upset stomach or diarrhea. An even more serious problem is that bacteria can become resistant to antibiotics if these medicines are used frequently in a lot of people. Then antibiotics wouldn't be able to cure people's illnesses. To prevent this from happening, doctors try to prescribe antibiotics only when they will help. Antibiotics only help when sore throat is caused by bacteria. Antibiotics don't help when sore throat is due to viruses, which are the cause of the common cold.

3 ...
It will take several days for you to feel better, no matter what kind of sore throat you have. You can do several things to help your symptoms. If you have a fever or muscle aches, you can take a pain reliever like acetaminophin (Tylenol), aspirin or ibuprofen (Advil). Your doctor can tell you which pain reliever will work best for you. Cough drops or throat sprays may help your sore throat. Sometimes gargling with warm salt water helps. Soft cold foods, such as ice cream and popsicles, often are easier to eat. Be sure to rest and to drink lots of water or other clear liquids, such as Sprite or 7-Up. Don't drink drinks that have caffeine in them (coffee, tea, colas or other sodas).

4 ...
Sometimes symptoms change during the course of an illness. Visit your doctor again if you have any of the following problems:
  • Fever that does not go away in five days
  • Throat pain that gets so bad you can't swallow
  • Inability to open your mouth wide
  • A fainting feeling when you stand up
  • Any other signs or symptoms that concern you

This information provides a general overview on sore throat and may not apply to everyone. Talk to your family doctor to find out if this information applies to you and to get more information on this subject. This information was provided by the American Academy of Family Physicians.

Bron: http://www.literacynet.org/vtd/articles.html

prompt.body: If you have a high fever with a sore throat, you should see your doctor ..............................

content.body: only if you have trouble swallowing.

prompt.body: Strep throat ..................

content.body: always comes with a cough and cold.

prompt.body: Which is NOT a common side effect of taking antibiotics?
Which does this article NOT recommend to make a sore throat feel better?
Antibiotics will help......................
When a bacteria becomes 'resistant' to an antibiotic, ....................................

content.body: the infection will not happen again.
the bacteria are killed right away.
the antibiotic no longer works to cure the infection.

prompt.body: Which of the following statements is TRUE according to this article?

content.body: Antibiotics will cure any sore throat.
The common cold is caused by a bacteria.
You should see your doctor at the first sign of a sore throat.
Taking antibiotics too much can be a bad idea.

items.content:
Bestudeer de woordenlijst.

Woordenlijst Treatment


Tip!
Er zijn verschillende manieren om woordjes te leren.
Je kunt de woorden hardop voorlezen of overschrijven.
Klik op de rode pijl voor meer opties!
Het belangrijkste is dat je dit niet te lang achter elkaar doet, want dan leer je niets meer.
In twee keer 10 minuten leer je meer dan in een half uur.

Irregular Verbs

Bestudeer de volgende drie irregular verbs (onregelmatige werkwoorden):

  • to hold
  • to keep
  • to know

hele werkwoord

past simple

voltooid deelwoord

Nederlands

to hold

held

held

houden

to keep

kept

kept

houden, bewaren

to know

knew

known

weten


Doe de opdrachten.

content.body:
Sleep de woorden naar de juiste plaats in de tabel.

I just came in for a check up.

Ik kom voor een .

I can see a lot of plaque.

Ik zie veel .

There is a cavity in one of your wisdom teeth.

Er zit een in één van je verstandskiezen.

We're going to remove the decay.

We gaan het verwijderen.

We may have to extract the tooth.

We moeten de tand/kies misschien trekken.

Can you give me something to dull the pain?

Kun je me iets geven om de pijn te ?

We'll try to minimize the discomfort.

We zullen proberen het zo klein mogelijk te houden.

Could you please give me the drill.

Kun je mij de aangeven?

I have problems breathing and swallowing.

Ik heb en slikken.

You may use over-the-counter medicines.

Je kunt in de vrije verkoop gebruiken.

Other medidcines should be prescribed by your GP.

Andere geneesmiddelen moeten door je huisarts worden.

He has been having a cough for days now.

Hij heeft al dagen last van een .

Did you have your tonsils removed?

Zijn jouw geknipt?

I think my neck glands are swollen.

Ik denk dat mijn zijn opgezet.

Antibiotics can cause other side effects.

Antibiotica kan andere veroorzaken.

It could also be the common cold.

Het kan ook een zijn.

I have a fever and muscle aches.

Ik heb koorts en .

It's time to take a pain reliever.

Het is tijd om een te nemen.

Sometimes gargling with warm salt water helps.

Soms helpt het om te met warm zout water..

Vertaal het Nederlandse woord in het Engels.

There is a major (gaatje) in one of your wisdom teeth.
I have a fever and (spierpijn).
We may have to (trekken) the tooth.
It could also be the (gewone verkoudheid).
We'll try to minimize the (ongemak).
Antibiotics can cause other (bijwerkingen).
Other medicines should be (voorgeschreven) by your GP.

Vul de ontbrekende werkwoordsvormen in.

hele werkwoord

past simple

voltooid deelwoord

Nederlands

to hold

houden

to keep

houden, bewaren
to know weten

items.content:
Grammar: Pronouns

  • Lees de uitleg in de kennisbank.
  • Maak de opdracht.

Demonstrative pronouns

prompt.body:
Choose the correct demonstrative pronoun (this, these, those, that).

I really like ......................... restaurant!

Choose the correct demonstrative pronoun.

I prefer ...................... glasses to ......................... ones over there.

Choose the correct demonstrative pronoun.

............................. chair is a lot more comfortable than ......................... one.

Choose the correct demonstrative pronoun.

Would you rather have ............................. strawberries or ................... peaches?

Choose the correct demonstrative pronoun.

For the price of ........................... video game you can buy three of ................. classic boardgames.

Choose the correct demonstrative pronoun.

I hope that ........................ summer will be nicer than ......................... weeks of rain we had last year.

Choose the correct demonstrative pronoun.

...................... boys over there challenged ..................... boys here to a football match.

Choose the correct demonstrative pronoun.

I like ................ film a lot more than .................... one they showed last week.

items.content:
Role play

You are going to role play a discussion between people who have different opinions about keeping teeth healthy.

  • Read the roles. (In groups of three, skip one role).
  • Decide who is going to play which role.
  • Act out the role play.


Role A: The dentist

You think the dentist is the best thing for oral hygiene. Tell the others why.

Which of the other ways of keeping your teeth healthy do you think is the least useful? Why?

Role B: Mouthwash

You think mouthwash is the best thing for oral hygiene. Tell the others why.

Which of the other ways of keeping your teeth healthy do you think is the least useful? Why?

Role C: Regular brushing

You think regular brushing is the best thing for oral hygiene. Tell the others why.

Which of the other ways of keeping your teeth healthy do you think is the least useful? Why?

Role D: No sweets

You think no sweets is the best thing for oral hygiene. Tell the others why.

Which of the other ways of keeping your teeth healthy do you think is the least useful? Why?

Visiting the dentist or GP

Je penvriend(in) heeft gevraagd waar jij met je vrienden over praat. De laatste keer heb je met je vrienden zitten praten de tandarts en de huisarts.

  • Maak de schrijfopdracht eerst alleen, daarna vergelijk je jouw e-mail met die van je groepsgenoten.
  • Schrijf een e-mail met je groepje en lever deze in bij je docent.

Je gaat een e-mail schrijven aan je penvriend(in) in Engeland.

Verwerk de volgende punten:

  • Bedenk een naam voor je penvriend(in).
  • Groet je penvriend(in).
  • Vertel waar jij en je vrienden laatst over gesproken hebben. (kies voor tandarts of huisarts)
  • Vertel over de laatste keer dat je bij de tandarts of huisarts bent geweest.
  • Vertel waarom je daar was. (zelf verzinnen)
  • Vertel over de behandeling.(zelf verzinnen)
  • Vraag wat je penvriend(in) enger vindt, de tandarts of de huisarts.
  • Verzin zelf iets om aan je penvriend(in) te schrijven.
  • Schrijf een passend slot.
  • Schrijf je naam onder de e-mail.

Vul het schema in en beantwoord de vragen onder het schema.

Activiteit leuk niet leuk makkelijk moeilijk weet ik al nieuw
Listening
Reading
Vocabulary
Grammar
Speaking
Writing

  • Waar moet ik nog aan werken?
  • Wat moet ik nog aan mijn docent vragen?

Don't Inject Me

You are going to listen to the song Don't Inject Me by Mike Adams, the Health Ranger.
What is his opinion about injecting people against diseases?

  • Watch the video.
  • Form groups of three or four pupils.
  • Discuss the question: What is his opinion about injecting people against diseases?
  • Report back to the class or your teacher.
